p: Histopathological analysis of liver sections provided an initial evidence of CCl 4-induced liver hepatocellular damage and fibrosis ( Figure 2 and Table 5). Degenerative changes including fatty degeneration, congestion, and cytoplasmic vacuolization were observed in the liver fibrosis control group ( Figure 2(b)). These findings were in agreement with those obtained by Ogaly et al. [ 14] and Yacout et al. [ 64]. Additionally, MT staining revealed clear fibrotic bridging in the liver sections of group 2 ( Figure 3(b)).
